contentText.text: Carlos refuses to accept Rafael’s offer of cash, but he decides to service the devices to avoid putting the Johnson Controls contract at risk.

During the next scheduled system inspection, a different Johnson Controls technician is on site. Rafael makes the same offer – but, instead of accepting, the technician calls his manager, who involves the Compliance team.

During the investigation that follows, Carlos is questioned about the previous inspection – and he admits that although he didn’t accept Rafael’s offer of money, he did service the devices that the customer installed.

revelCollOut.text: Rafael seemed very angry when I told him I couldn’t service the devices – and we have a lot of business with this building. It didn't take me much time to do the work, and it seemed worth it.
But now I realize that I should have used better judgment by not servicing the devices, and I should have spoken to my manager at the time. I could really get in trouble for what I did.
